Table 1. Evidence on Progress towards SRF targets (Sphere of interest)
SLO Target (2022) Brief summary of new evidence of CGIAR contribution

[Put N/A if the specific SRF target is not applicable to your CRP. Put "No new evidence in 2018" if the target is potentially relevant, but there is no new evidence available. Spell out all acronyms.]

 Expected additional contribution before end of 2022

(If not already fully covered.)
[Optional narrative. Evidence not required.]
Max. 150 words per entry Max. 100 words
1.1. 100 million more farm households have adopted improved varieties, breeds, trees, and/or managements practices
1.2. 30 million people, of which 50% are women, assisted to exit poverty
2.1. Improve the rate of yield increase for major food staples from current <1% to 1.2%-2.5% per year
2.2. 30 million more people, of which 50% are women, meeting minimun dietary energy requirements
2.3. 150 million more people, of which 50% are women, without deficiencies in one or more essential micronutriets
3.1. 5% increase in water and nutrient efficiency in agroecosystems
3.2. Reduction in 'agriculturally' related greenhouse gas emissions by 5%
3.3. 55 M ha degraded land area restored
3.4. 2.5 M ha forest saved from deforestation

This table has available high-quality evidences on progress that was published or made available in 2018. 

Control List for the disaggregation
SLO Targets

System Level Outcomes targets defined. In order to fill this table, should call the “Get all targets of a year” like this /v2/slo-targets?year=2022 to retrieve just the 2022 targets. Services:

GET:

Get all: /v2/slo-targets

Get all targets of a year: /v2/slo-targets?year={year}

Get one by id: /v2/slo-targets/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

CGIAR Entities

This service includes CGIAR Research Programs (CRP’s), CGIAR platforms and CGIAR centers. To report this indicator should include just the “CRP” and “Platforms” types.

GET:

Get all: /v2/cgiar-entities

Get all by type: /v2/cgiar-entities?type={entity-type}

Get one by id: /v2/cgiar-entities/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Indicator administration

CLARISA allows the creation of new progress evidences in order to fill this table. Additionally, allows to update, retrieve and delete evidences.

GET:

Get all evidences: /v2/progress-evidences-sfr-targets/

Get all evidences of a CRP: /v2/progress-evidences-sfr-target?crp={id-crp}

Get one evidence by id: /v2/progress-evidences-sfr-targets/{evidence-id}

POST:

Create a new evidence: /v2/progress-evidences-sfr-targets/

DELETE:

Delete (Disable) an evidence by id:/v2/progress-evidences-sfr-targets/{evidence-id}

PUT:

Update information of an evidence: /v2/progress-evidences-sfr-targets/{evidence-id}

Table 2. Condensed list of policy contributions in this reporting year (Policies Guidance)
Name and description of policy, legal instrument, investment or curriculum to which CGIAR contributed

(20-50 words, ideally around 20 words)
Spell out acronyms in every row

 Level of Maturity Link to sub-IDOs (max. 2) CGIAR cross-cutting market score Link to OICR or link to evidence
Gender Youth CapDev Climate Change
Control List for the disaggregation
CGIAR Sub-IDOs

Sub intermediate development outcomes

GET:

Get all: /v2/srf-sub-idos

Get one by id: /v2/srf-sub-idos/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Cross-cutting markers

List of CGIAR Cross-cutting markers.

GET:

Get all: /v2/cross-cutting-markers

Get one by id: /v2/cross-cutting-markers/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Cross-cutting marker scores

List of possible scores on each cross-cutting marker. On MARLO Exists 5 possible scores, but for policy just 4 are applicable.

GET:

Get all: /v2/cross-cutting-marker-scores

Get one by id: /v2/cross-cutting-marker-scores/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Policy/investment Types

The category to which the change refers.

GET:

Get all: /v2/policy-investment-types

Get one by id: /v2/policy-investment-types/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Policies owner type

Type of the primary organization(s) either designing/promulgating the policy, law, investment (e.g. national government) etc. and/or within which it is operating

GET:

Get all: /v2/policy-owner-types

Get one by id: /v2/policy-owner-types/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Geographic Scopes

The level at which the impact of the change is expected to be realized.

GET:

Get all: /v2/geographic-scopes

Get one by id: /v2/geographic-scopes/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

United Nations Regions

Geographical regions defined by UN (M49 code).

GET:

Get all: /v2/un-regions

Get one by id: /v2/un-regions/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Countries

Worldwide countries.

GET:

Get all: /v2/countries

Get one by id: /v2/countries/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Level of maturity of the policy

GET:

Get all: /v2/policy-maturity-levels

Get one by id: /v2/policy-maturity-levels/{id}

POST: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

DELETE: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

PUT: Not applicable as this control list will be updated internally

Indicator administration

CLARISA allows the creation of new policies in order to fill this table. Additionally, allows to update, retrieve and delete evidences. Take in mind that should be send all the guidance fields, not just the table columns.

GET:

Get all policies: /v2/policies/

Get all policies of a CRP: /v2/progress-evidences-sfr-target?crp={id-crp}

Get one policy by id: /v2/progress-evidences-sfr-targets/{evidence-id}

POST:

Create a new policy: /v2/policies/

DELETE:

Delete (Disable) a policy by id: /v2/policies/{policy-id} /v2/progress-evidences-sfr-targets/{evidence-id}

PUT:

Update information of a policy: /v2/policies/{policy-id}
